newsitem.title: UK: Sherry connoisseur Jose Ignacio Domecq dies at 82.
newsitem.headline: Sherry connoisseur Jose Ignacio Domecq dies at 82.

text.p: Jose Ignacio Domecq Gonzalez, known as El Nariz (The Nose) for his skill as a connoisseur of sherries, brandies and other spirits has died in Jerez, Spain aged 82, drinks group Allied Domecq said on Thursday.
"He personified the sherry industry and was a wonderful ambassador for sherry and brandy around the world," said Peter Macfarlane, Chairman of Pedro Domecq SA.
Gonzalez will perhaps be best remembered as the figure in a Domecq sherry television advert where he was pictured sampling a sherry's bouquet.
He started his career with Domecq in 1940 in Jerez, becoming a board director of Pedro Domecq in 1947.
Pedro Domecq, one of the oldest sherry companies in Jerez was formed in 1730 and acquired by the Domecq family in 1816.
The family expanded its interests into Mexico in 1941 and in 1956 Pedro Domecq Mexico became a subsidiary of Pedro Domecq.
Since then further overseas subsidiary companies have been established including those in the U.S., Brazil and Columbia.
